avalancheActivity.highlights: Some new snow on top of older windslabs and firn. New windslabs possible at highest mountains. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls. Some snow predicted in mountains on Sunday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some new snow on top of older windslabs and firn. New windslabs possible at highest mountains. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-A átt um helgina með rigningu en snjókomu til fjalla. Fremur hæg N-læg átt svo hæg breytileg átt og þurrt fram á þriðjudag. Bætir í úrkomu seinnipart þriðjudags.

avalancheActivity.comment: Couple of small avalanches in Kirkjubólshlíð, NW-aspect, fell this week. A small slab avalanche also fell from Skollahvilft above Flateyri.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in N-NE snowdrift. Weak layers exist in the snowpack, even though most places they don´t seem very touchy.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has been added in three storms, in mid March, during Easter and after last weekend. Snowdrift has been ongoing in N and NE winds. There has not been any thaw, so thick wind slabs have formed in gullies and leesides of mountains. They are considered rather stable in most places, but if avalanches would release they might become large. People travelling in steep slopes and gullies might trigger avalanches, especially where the weaknesses are shallow, i.e. in convex landscape features and around cliffs or rocks.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-A snjókoma möguleg með sunnudeginum en spánni fylgir óvissa. Á mánudag verður NA hvassviðri og éljagangur til fjalla 10-15 m/sek. Styttir upp og lægir með þriðjudeginum.

avalancheActivity.comment: 10. April: Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2, elev: 600 m, aspect: SSE) in Bæjarfjall. 9.April Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2.5, elev: 600 m, aspect: S) in Bæjarfjall. Natural avalanche cycle size 2-2,5 in SE-SW aspect on april 7th and 8th. Many human triggered avalanches were released the days after the Easter-snowstorm and many big natural slab avalanches occured during the snowstorm. A rather large avalanche released in Héðinsfjarðardalur on March 26th, likely triggered by snowmobiles with remote triggering indicates a pwl
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered windslabs in most aspects but mainly after prevailing NE winds. Persistent weak layer still present in snowprofiles, avalanches falling on this old weakness can be large. People traveling in the mountains are encouraged to exercise extreme caution and carefully consider their route choices.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Prevailing NE winds and snow have increased windslab formation. A snowprofile from Siglufjörður, 13/4, shows layered windslabs on top of PWL at a windslab interfaces and firn. Compression tests show SP breaks under mod loads on the PWL (CT14, SP @70cm) as well as at the interfaces of the new snow and wind-packed snow (CT11, SP @17cm). PWL at the interfaces of wind slabs and older snow has been widespread and particularly sensitive in the upper parts of the mountains. Snowprofiles confirm that this weakness still exists and may be at significant depths due to prevailing NE winds and snow. Avalanches falling on this PWL can be large. People traveling in the mountains are urged to exercise extreme caution and carefully consider their route.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og bjart viðri á sunnudag. Norðlægar áttir og lítilsháttar éljagangur á mánudag og þriðjudag

avalancheActivity.comment: Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after this weeks snowfall and warming. On the 7th of April, a rather large slab avalanche released in Harðskafi above Eskifjörður during a NE storm. Wide slab also released in the northern part of Mjóifjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow remains high in the mountains and inland after a NE snowstorm during last weekend followed by additional snowfall on Thursday. Weaknesses can be expected between wind slabs of different hardness and avalanches have been falling.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Recent NE storms deposited additional snow atop already existing wind slabs formed during Easter. This has led to significant accumulation, particularly in the leeward sides of mountains and in gullies and depressions, especially above 400-500 meters altitude. Weak points have been identified between layers of wind slabs, particularly where there are differences in snow hardness. Additionally, deep presistent weakness has been identified in older snow at higher elevations. While chances of natural avalanches are decreasing, individuals traversing steep slopes and gullies should be cautious as they could trigger avalanches. Especially after the snowfall with easterly winds on Sunday.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjóar í A-SA áttum á sunnudag en slydda á láglendi. Snýr í NV átt með lítilsháttar éljabökkum á mánudag.
